intro: Lampranthus recurvus, commonly known as the firecracker flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its bright orange to red tubular flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Lampranthus recurvus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and drought tolerance.
